content.label: Amazing

First, let's get this out of the way: this game is hard. Especially past the first 10-12 levels. For that reason, it is probably best on iPad, and not for those that don't enjoy a challenge. The beauty of this game is that it's an experience no other device can replicate. Most games on iOS could easily be replicated on your computer or console... Not this. This takes full advantage of and require multitouch. It's one of the few games that's true about. For that reason alone, it's worth playing. I loved the original version, and Infinity improves it all around.

Eliss Infinity makes me feel happy when I play it. The rules are simple and yet the geometric mastery required to maneuver your circles successfully is difficult to master. This creates a perfect game loop, easy to grasp, difficult to master. Playing, and hearing this game elicits pure joy every time.

Mo highly recommend not only buying this game, but investing your precious time in its relaxing ambiance.
â€¦For larger screens!!!!!!!!

title.label: Worst $3 I've spent in the App Store

content.label: Sorry but this app should only be for iPads because I tried playing it on my iPhone 5c and firstly, you have to have a flat surface, you have to use all your fingers, when on an iPod or iPhone it's just to small. The game itself is kinda junky, but I can see little kids liking it. Not recommended.

A fabulous iOS game! The menus are a joy to navigate. They feel so intuitive and are honestly just fun into be in! I love the gameplay, and how natural it feels. You do what you're supposed to, and you get rewarded for it!
Perfectly made, hard, fun achievements to earn!

The idea of this game is good but to control the circles and survive is hard. They keep bouncing when you need them to stay. When you try to move the circles, they will stuck when touching circles with different color and die quickly. I really want to play this game so I got this on both my iPhone and iPad. But the experience is terrible either way. The F word go through my mind a lot while playing. So when I finally complete a stage I don't feel happy.
#charm.
Super cool

This is a game obviously for someone much younger than I (most everybody), with quick reflexes and the ability to discern what is happening with utter chaos on the screen. Too much going on for me, with no clue how the scoring is done, or, for that matter, what any of it does. Other than getting the circles inside the wheels, I admit, I'm clueless. I'll mention this one to my sons (all grown-ups), maybe one of them will like. I'll pass

Okay, this game has a simple yet hard to master concept and has a lot of potential. But honestly, I think that only people with iPads should buy this. Eliss Infinity stresses the use of all your fingers which means that you would be laying your iDevice on your lap or something to have access to all fingers. I found it very difficult to get by using only my thumbs as Eliss Infinity is actually pretty hard. And even with my device laying flat, I found it really hard to use all my fingers as the iPod Touch 5G really isn't that big. So I would recommend you purchasing this only if you have access to an iPad. Anyone with a smaller device should stand back. Also, I found Eliss Infinity a bit overpriced for the amount of content it offered. Im just glad I got this while its on sale. Im giving it three stars.

I don't think I've ever written a bad review before!  This game is seriously not fun.  I'm not sure where all of these 5 star reviews come from, but this thing is supremely boring (and quite ugly).  It's like some social experiment to see how many people will pay for a crap nasty looking game given enough positive reviews or something.
First and only five star I've ever given.  This app is completely thought through from the music to the tutorial.  Delightful experience.
I played the previous version on my original iPhone, and never got tired of it! This version brings a few more features, and iPad support - love it!
A unique gaming experience. A must have for any iOS device. Love love love.

title.label: More elegant and challenging than the original

content.label: Just buy this game, simply fantastic!

Challenging, intelligent, beautifully designed. I owned the iPhone version of this game and bought it for my iPad when I saw it had an iPad version just to support the devs, but it turns out this game is even better played on an iPad. In my mind definitely a must-have
Been there since the beginning! Oh how I've missed you Eliss! Now I get to play infinity more times. Thanks guys.

The idea is unique and it can be fun to play. However, since you are moving these large circular shapes  around in such a small cramped space the game shouldn't start me over for two colors simply touching. I should get like 2 or 3 seconds to separate them before to have to start over. This aspect of the game makes it non user friendly. I've played level 8 over 100 times simply because two colors merely touched.

The game's tutorial is quite drawn out. Have to keep restarting it if you let the screen dim. Game crashes and plays poorly on a 5s. Overall an opaque experience. Would not recommend for the up front cost it has.
This game is definitely not worth the money. Keep your money and buy something better!
A fantastic game by a fantastic designer... Cannot wait for faraway
Worst game ever. Clearly paid for favorable reviews
Worth every penny. I love a game that is fun to play, but still challenging. Really love the graphics and music as well. Infinity mode is quite addictive.

Great game, but It's quite clear that the developer didn't take the time to adjust it so it wasn't impossible to play at the higher levels. 

Games require adjustment to make sure they don't get too difficult too quickly before the player builds up a skill in the game mechanic being presented. In this case of Eliss Infinity, that game mechanic is beautiful and simple, but poorly adjusted through the higher levels. At level 15, the game becomes impossible to play and you rely mostly on luck to hope that things are presented properly. 

The game mechanic is also very unforgiving. If you get into trouble, it can become difficult or impossible to restore balance to complete a level.

My suggestions would be:
1) Have more levels and ramp the player's skill up slower. Doing it too fast leads to frustration and disappointment.
2) If you aren't going to do 1) make the energy depletion on intersection slower. Also, allow more recharge power ups.
3) One thing the game designer did was to make the play field feel cramped at the higher levels. This is a cheap way to make the game hard. In a game with multitouch as a key mechanic, this eliminates any ability the player develops early to move things around. Saying that you can split spheres is a cop-out. With all the stuff on the screen, trying to get the player to master another skill makes the game even more unplayable.

Other than those things, the abstract nature of the game and the general design are very nice.
Boring. Don't waste $3 on this game

A stunning, thoughtfully crafted and innovative game, Eliss Infinity is unlike anything else out there. Multi-touch gameplay is fun and challenging, especially in Infinity mode! Music is dazzling. Graphics stay true to pixel perfect planets and star fields, sparkling across the screen. The Eliss universe has expanded and I love what I see.

title.label: Great game, delightful visual and interaction design

content.label: Be sure to play it on top of a surface, you will need all those fingers.
It's not a full-blown sequel, it's an update to the original. And it's still great! Worth every penny.

Only owners of iPhone 1-2 will remember this one and truly understand the masterpiece that is Eliss. This is one of the first games I ever bought on the App Store probably 6-7 years ago. And it has literally been in my phone ever since. Buy this game. There should be no question.

At first I found myself wondering if I should get this game. I trusted the reviews and I was not let down. This game is difficult yet very entertaining. I specifically love the audio. Such beautiful audio should not go unnoticed. This game is well worth the $3.
Just as awesome as the original

I loved the original Eliss, but wanted it native on the iPad. Eliss Infinity is awesome on the larger screen. Also, I love the new Infinity mode (since I tend to get stuck in the levels). Great job Steph!

Thank you for such a great game! Keep the updates coming, and I am sure to buy the next game that comes out by this maker. The three modes are great as well as the graphics, good job and congratulations for finally releasing it!

I'm strongly beginning to think reviews are loaded. This game is not the gem these reviewers carve it out to be. The graphics are bad, but I guess that's the point (i.e. hipster developers making "modern" retro feel to a game, that surely hadn't been done before). To me, that translates to complete lack of originality. 

To its merit, I will say that the gameplay is novel for the most part. Go online and watch gameplay video before you buy. As it stands, this game is not worth its cost.

title.label: Eliss is one if my favorite games of all time

content.label: No joke, it's one of the best things I've ever played. LOVE IT!!
This game has epic graphics, music and gameplay. Don't miss this gem...

This is a very fun game, very beautiful in design and it can be a real challenge. I have one feature request: please add iCloud support for saving. This game is better on iPad but it would be nice if I could take my progress with me when I go out.

title.label: Possibly the Most Important Multitouch Game

content.label:
The original Eliss was maybe the most important multitouch game. At a very formative time in iOS gaming it was a statement as to what a multitouch game could be: not derivative of past video games, but forward thinking, complex, action-oriented yet a thinking-man's game. Like the classic Qix, it was a boiled-down expression of exactly what its platform was capable of.

Eliss Infinity, then, is the refinement of that vision. The Infinity mode in particular, informed by such challenging successes as Super Hexagon and Ziggurat, brings an insane urgency to the already rock-solid gameplay. The day the original iPad came out I wished for this game, now, four years on, finally we have it. The Infinity mode of Eliss is to die for.

What can I say about this game that isn't glowing? Here's a thing: I wish on iPad this didn't still so,ehow manage to look like a blown up iPhone game. Keep the level size and object size, but just increase the resolution. Speaking of resolution: I'm no longer convinced a pixel-y aesthetic is the way to go. I think I would of preferred an art style more in the vein of your icon. Smooth circles with a digital feel to their shading. That would've been rad.

But as an aesthetic complaint, this is minor. Eliss Infinity is the best game on iOS devices this year, a title I wouldn't be surprised to see it retain. It's important, it's compelling, and above all it's fun. Played in a room of non-games last night, it couldn't help bit catch everyone's eye â€” because despite being based on a game several years old, it is surprisingly, invigoratingly fresh.

Buy this. Play this. Know how good it can be, when a game doesn't pander to what you think you want but rather delivers on what it can be.
Now that this remakeis a top seller, shouldn't Game Center achievements be added?

title.label: Excellent revision of a previous excellent Game

content.label: Taking the best of the original Eliss, refining it's mechanics, and making new modes along with sharp Retina graphics really makes this game excellent.
This game is literally iOS perfection. simple to learn, but definitely challenging as well. the endless mode has you wanting to beat your high score game after game. don't hesitate to purchase this.

title.label: Great rerelease for a great game

content.label:
Visually gratifying. Rhythmically satisfying. Brutally Challenging. Tactilely stimulating. I can't say enough about this great game.

100x better than flappy bird
Great release, as the previous game. Benchmark iOS puzzler.

I can't seem to get enough of great indie games lately. I was on the fence about purchasing this for $3 but I trusted the good reviews and this game did not let me down. It's got a great interface and it starts out easy but it gets very challenging after a bit. The coolest thing about the game is how involved you are with multitouch and using your fingers to do different tasks at the same time. It really gets your brain working!

To call this game "innovative" is an understatement. This is a landmark achievement. It redefines what games are. Well, I'm talking about the first version- this one actually takes that one, which was infinitely good and adds an infinite mode, making it infinitely better. 

And so, more than 100 years after Cantor's theory on transfinite numbers was unceremoniously rejected by his contemporaries, in Eliss Infinity we now have incontrovertible proof that Cantor was right all along: Just because something is infinite in scope doesn't mean something else can't come along and be even more impressive!  

Everyone with at least four fingers should play this!
I conceivable no incontent unbeen bargis. Sweet jesus lady this rombulus

I'm so glad to see this come back. Nice job!
One complaint, I miss the old pixely icon :)
I've been waiting on this forever! My favor iOS game.
